source.description: Document containing an element with mixed content but statically could have element only content.

schema.description: Document containing an element with mixed content but statically could have element only content.

source.description: Document containing some nasty cases for fn:data.

schema.description: Schema containing some nasty cases for fn:data.

test-case.name: K-DataFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `data()`.

test-case.name: K-DataFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `data(1, "wrong param")`.

test-case.name: K-DataFunc-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(data((1, 2, 3, 4, 5))) eq 5`.

test-case.name: K-DataFunc-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(data( () ))`.

test-case.name: K2-DataFunc-1
test-case.description: fn:data() allows zero arguments in XP30/XQ30.

test-case.name: K2-DataFunc-2
test-case.description: fn:data() must be passed at most one argument.

test-case.name: K2-DataFunc-3
test-case.description: fn:data() allows zero arguments in XP30/XQ30.

test-case.name: K2-DataFunc-4
test-case.description: fn:data() allows zero arguments in XP30/XQ30. No context item

test-case.name: K2-DataFunc-5
test-case.description: fn:data() allows zero arguments in XP30/XQ30. Context item is a function item

test-case.name: K2-DataFunc-6
test-case.description: fn:data() allows zero arguments in XP30/XQ30. Context item is an element with no typed value

test-case.name: fn-datacomplextype-1
test-case.description: Evaluates the "data" function with the argument set to a complex element
test-case.test: import schema namespace mc ="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTest/mixedcontent"; fn:data( validate { <mc:weather> <mc:temperature>30</mc:temperature> <mc:precipitation>10</mc:precipitation> </mc:weather> } )

test-case.name: ST-Data001
test-case.description: Evaluates the "data" function on a node that statically has mixed content and could potentially have element only content.

test-case.name: fn-data-1
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:data whose argument is a complex type with element only content.

test-case.name: fn-data-2
test-case.description: Atomize an array (empty)

test-case.name: fn-data-3
test-case.description: Atomize an array (all atomic)

test-case.name: fn-data-4
test-case.description: Atomize an array (contains untyped nodes)

test-case.name: fn-data-5
test-case.description: Atomize an array (contains nested sequences)

test-case.name: fn-data-6
test-case.description: Atomize an array (contains nested arrays)

test-case.name: fn-data-7
test-case.description: Atomize a map (not allowed)

modified.change: Bug fix relating #27180: Change error code

test-case.name: cbcl-data-001
test-case.description: test fn:data on fn:error Author: Tim Mills

test-case.name: cbcl-data-002
test-case.description: fn:data on a complex type with simple content

test-case.name: cbcl-data-003
test-case.description: fn:data on a union type

test-case.description: fn:data on a list type

test-case.name: cbcl-data-005
test-case.description: fn:data on a union type possibly containing a list type

test-case.name: cbcl-data-006
test-case.description: fn:data on a more complicated type heirarchy

test-case.name: cbcl-data-007
test-case.description: fn:data on list of union type
